results.title: A Chance for children
results.creator_credit: Michael Craven, Thomas Craven Film Corporation and UNICEF
results.brief_description: Shows how breast feeding, growth charts, oral rehydration therapy and immunization are successful in lowering child mortality and provide millions of children with an improved quality of life.

results.title: A Chance Affair
results.brief_description: Chance makes a declaration to his best mate Jeff only to realise that what he thought was there can disappear just like smoke. Meanwhile, club diva Aviante sends a message to all the little wannabes out there who try and sing Whitney’s signature songs.

constellations_other.name: Broadcasting marginal voices
constellations_other.description: The creation of Indigenous broadcasting in Central Australia from the late 1970s meant an array of diverse Black stories could be shared. Today, important stories told by those who physically and metaphorically live on the margins can be broadcast widely.

results.description: Chance makes a declaration to his best mate Jeff only to realise that what he thought was there can disappear just like smoke. Meanwhile, club diva Aviante sends a message to all the little wannabes out there who try and sing Whitney’s signature songs.

results.title: A Chairy tale
results.brief_description: This film depicts a young man and a chair (animated by Evelyn Lambart) that declines to be sat upon. The ensuing struggle, sometimes farcical, sometimes thoughtful, is an open-ended commentary on relationships. The technique used is pixilation. The musical accompaniment is by Ravi Shankar and Chatur Lal.

results.title: A Certified tractor
results.creator_credit: Robert Hesselschwerdt and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: Shows the various methods of testing tractors by the Australian Tractor Testing Committee. Accurate measurement of belt and engine power, noise level at the driver’s ear and fuel consumption; pulling power; location of the centre of gravity; dismantling of engine and checking after 60 hours use; critical assessment of the general features.

results.title: A Century or the sack
results.creator_credit: Patricia Ludford, Kip Porteous and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description: Looks at sheep shearing in Australia, and the contrasting outlooks of three shearers. A shearing contractor explains the conditions that today’s shearing gangs require, and shearers’ wives have their say. Filmed mainly in the Parkes district of New South Wales.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Patricia Ludford, Kip Porteous and Australian Broadcasting Commission

results.title: A Case study in mechanism (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: David Jackson, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description: An examination of the benzyne mechanism for nucleophilic aromatic substitution. Queries whether SN1 or SN2 mechanisms for nucleophilic substitution at a saturated carbon atom can be applied at an unsaturated or aromatic carbon atom. Looks at evidence for a modified version of the SN2 mechanism.
results.description: An examination of the benzyne mechanism for nucleophilic aromatic substitution. results.title: A Case for shiftwork?
results.creator_credit: Anvil Films and British Productivity Council
results.brief_description: The case for and against shiftwork in industry. The film follows the investigation of a textile factory by a visiting consultant who produces a prima facie case for shiftwork while flashbacks show it was successfully introduced in other factories. Discussion with management and shop floor illuminate various systems of shiftwork and the organizational and human problems involved in its application.

results.title: A Case for handling
results.creator_credit: Peter M Plaskitt, Humphrey Swingler and Greenpark Productions
results.brief_description: Under the guidance of a consultant, a foundry adopts numerous materials-handling devices; as a result of speeding the flow of castings from one point to another and using now redundant labourers on productive semi-skilled tasks, output increased by 20%. Although mainly concerned with the re-conversion of one factory, the film shows a wide range of materials-handling methods in other industries, including the use of cranes, lifting blocks, runways, conveyors, unit loads, palletization etc.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter M Plaskitt, Humphrey Swingler and Greenpark Productions

results.title: A Career in nursing
results.brief_description:
Presents an overview of nursing training in Australia and gives a general outline of what is involved in each of the three years of training required for qualifications as a nursing sister. Points out avenuyes open after qualification.
NB: Out of date information.

results.title: A Career in commercial television
results.creator_credit: Tony Wellington and Artransa Park Studios
results.brief_description: Looks at the administrative, engineering and production aspects of commercial television, concentrating in particular on production. Stresses the limited opportunities available in this field and how most people in production commence work at the bottom rung of the production ladder. Narrated by Roger Climpson. Suitable for secondary school level.
